alert.note: Alert for Adams; Lincoln; Spokane; Whitman (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 11 at 5:22PM PST until January 11 at 6:00PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM PST FOR NORTHEASTERN ADAMS...NORTHEASTERN WHITMAN...SOUTHEASTERN LINCOLN AND SOUTHERN SPOKANE COUNTIES... At 522 PM PST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 14 miles northeast of Ritzville to 14 miles north of Colfax, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Flash freeze on roads. Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 in Washington between mile markers 222 and 253. U.S. Highway 195 in Washington between mile markers 41 and 73. Locations impacted include... Ritzville, Palouse, Tekoa, Garfield, Rosalia, St. John, Sprague, Oakesdale, Malden, Latah, Farmington, Lamont, Mohler, Amber, Steptoe, Tokio, Revere, Belmont, Lamona, and Thornton. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges, and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for a sudden loss of traction. Slow down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
